00029 #include "EulerIvpOdeSolver.hpp"
00030 
00031 void EulerIvpOdeSolver::CalculateNextYValue(AbstractOdeSystem* pAbstractOdeSystem,
00032                                             double timeStep,
00033                                             double time,
00034                                             std::vector<double>& rCurrentYValues,
00035                                             std::vector<double>& rNextYValues)
00036 {
00037     // For each timestep in AbstractOneStepIvpSolver calculates a vector containing
00038     // the next Y value from the current one for each equation in the system.
00039 
00040     const unsigned num_equations = pAbstractOdeSystem->GetNumberOfStateVariables();
00041 
00042     // Yes, this looks weird, but it makes good use of memory!
00043     pAbstractOdeSystem->EvaluateYDerivatives(time, rCurrentYValues, rNextYValues);
00044 
00045     for (unsigned i=0; i<num_equations; i++)
00046     {
00047         // rNextYValues contains dY/dt until here
00048         rNextYValues[i] = rCurrentYValues[i] + timeStep*rNextYValues[i];
00049     }
00050 }
